FuncDef: Using the reset arp packet statistics command, you can reset statistics about Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) packets.
CLIs: reset arp packet statistics [ slot <slot-id> | interface [ <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of a board. If this parameter is specified, the command clears ARP packet statistics about ARP packets on this board.
If this parameter is not specified, the command clears ARP packet statistics about ARP packets on all boards.
-

Clears the statistics about ARP packets sent and received by all Layer 3 interfaces.
-

Specifies a Layer 3 interface. After this parameter is specified, the command clears the statistics about the ARP packets received by this interface.
-

Specifies a Layer 3 interface. After this parameter is specified, the command clears the statistics about the ARP packets received by this interface.
-

Specifies a Layer 3 interface. After this parameter is specified, the command clears the statistics about the ARP packets received by this interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the user wants to view statistics of ARP packets by using the display arp packet statistics command. In order to obtain accurate statistics, the user needs to execute the command to clear the existing statistics.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the display arp packet statistics command to view statistics about ARP packets.
